description.narrative: -IFC investment will generate positive climate change impacts in the Sisecam Group through energy efficiency investments financed by the use of the proceeds from the equity sale, particularly in areas such as waste heat recovery. -IFC''s proposed equity investment in Soda is expected to have an important signaling effect at a difficult time in Turkish markets and enhance liquidity for Soda shares.

Established in 1969 Soda Sanayii (Soda or the Company) is Turkeys sole domestic synthetic soda and chromium producer. Soda has a foothold in foreign markets, namely through its subsidiary in Bosnia Herzegovina and joint venture with Solvay in Bulgaria in the soda ash business and Chromital in Italy in the chromium segment. Soda ranks among the top 10 soda ash producers in the world and fourth in Europe, with a 15% market share. The project entails an IFC equity investment of up to US$25 million in Soda, in which Trakya Cam Sanayii A.S. (or Trakya Cam) and Anadolu Cam Sanayii A.S. (or Anadolu Cam) will be selling shares to IFC and which in turn are expected to use the proceeds in energy efficiency investments. Sisecam (or Group) has invited IFC to become a shareholder in Soda, as part of the Groups program of eliminating cross-ownership in the Group.
